action: Move gripper to the front-right bowl (designated as the 'front bowl')

action: Close gripper to grasp the front-right bowl
reasoning: I am now positioned directly above the front-right bowl with my gripper open. To pick it up, I need to secure it. I am closing my gripper to get a firm hold on the bowl.

I have successfully grasped the front-right bowl, confirmed by my 'grip: closed' status. Now, I must lift it vertically to a safe height, ensuring it clears the surface and any other nearby objects before I transport it to the stacking location.

action: Move the grasped bowl towards the top-right bowl (designated as the 'middle bowl')

action: Lower the grasped bowl onto the top-right bowl
reasoning: I have aligned the grasped (front-right) bowl above the top-right (middle) bowl. Now, I am carefully lowering the grasped bowl to stack it onto the top-right bowl. I need to ensure a gentle and stable placement to complete the stack successfully.

action: Open gripper to release the stacked bowl
reasoning: The front-right bowl is now securely stacked on the top-right (middle) bowl. My task of placing it is complete, so I am opening my gripper to release the bowl. My grip status will change from 'closed' to 'open'.

I have successfully released the bowl, and my gripper is now open. To complete the operation and avoid collision, I am now retracting my arm upwards and away from the stacked bowls and the workspace, moving to a safe, neutral position.
